intro: Isolepis perrottetii, commonly known as the slender marsh sedge, is a perennial grass-like plant native to wetland habitats in southern Africa. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant typically grows in dense clusters, with narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered flower heads. It thrives in moist, nutrient-poor soils and is often found in marshes and along the edges of water bodies. Its structure and growth habits make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
